intro: Spermacoce jacobsonii var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth spermacoce, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. The plant has smooth, glabrous leaves and stems, giving it its varietal name. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
